summary: As recruits enter the military, the 4 service branches are required to pay into a fund to cover the estimated cost of their retirement benefits. Each service currently pays the same percentage of basic pay. A proposed law would have required the Department of Defense to calculate a contribution rate specific to each service. DOD concluded the proposal would have likely increased Air Force and...
title: Military Retirement: Service Contributions Do Not Reflect Service Specific Estimated Costs and Full Effect of Proposed Legislation is Unknown
